meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: FLY OR DIE
Microsoft's about to release Surface, the most important product it's made since the Xbox. So why is it freaking out right now? Because it can't afford to lose another decade.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RG7k0O&via=Digg&text=Why Microsoft's Tablet Can't Fail

div.div: FREEDOM
The covert trail that's helped thousands of refugees escape.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xp4H46&via=Digg&text=North Korea's Underground Railroad

div.div: TERRORISM

div.a: Suspected Terrorist Arrested For Alleged Plot To Attack NYC

div.div: NBC 4 New York has learned that federal authorities have arrested a man they say was plotting to attack the Federal Reserve in New York City.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RDpKf7&via=Digg&text=Suspected Terrorist Arrested For Alleged Plot To Attack NYC

div.div: HITCHIKER'S GUIDES

div.a: An Exo-Tourist's Guide To Our Closest Alien Planet

div.div: Now that we know our nearest neighbouring star system, Alpha Centauri, contains at least one planet, it's time to go exo-tourist and plan a trip. But be sure to read our travel guide first.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QWjuQj&via=Digg&text=An Exo-Tourist's Guide To Our Closest Alien Planet

div.div: TAMING OF THE CROWD

div.a: The Story Of Crowd Behavior In Grand Central Station

div.div: The hustle and bustle that characterizes this space is more than a chaotic scramble to get somewhere, however: Grand Central Station represents an early exercise in New York City’s history to contain and tame the Crowd.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QU5TZC&via=Digg&text=The Story Of Crowd Behavior In Grand Central Station

div.div: NO MORE FREE BEER
Yet another Armstrong sponsor has dropped the beleaguered athlete in the wake of his ongoing doping scandal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WAAnnR&via=Digg&text=Anheuser-Busch Drops Armstrong

div.div: PAY UP

div.a: Starbucks Under Investigation For Tax Strategies

div.div: Two British parliamentary committees are due to quiz tax officials about how Starbucks was able to avoid paying tax on 1.2 billion pounds ($1.93 billion) of sales since 2009.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WlT9AK&via=Digg&text=Starbucks Under Investigation For Tax Strategies

div.div: BEST COMMUTE EVER
There are many ways to cross the River Seine, but the inflatable trampoline bridge envisioned by Paris-based agency AZC must surely be one of the most enjoyable ones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V3HDos&via=Digg&text=The Inflatable Trampoline Bridge

div.div: EVERYONE NEEDS A HOME

div.a: The Real Reason The U.S. Economy Is Starting To Improve

div.div: Is the latest improvement in unemployment a statistical fluke, a political conspiracy or the start of something real? The answer is obvious to those monitoring the housing market.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Va1dFt&via=Digg&text=The Real Reason The U.S. Economy Is Starting To Improve

div.div: INVESTMENTS

div.a: Most Bitcoin Currency Gets Stashed Under Digital Mattresses

div.div: More than three-quarters of the digital coins in the Bitcoin digital currency scheme aren't circulating because they remain dormant in user accounts that have never participated in outgoing transactions, a recently published study has found.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V9phZ1&via=Digg&text=Most Bitcoin Currency Gets Stashed Under Digital Mattresses

div.div: COMIC CON

One of the best parts of any New York Comic Con is the walk to the Javits Center, when hundreds of people dressed as superheroes, alternate universe Victorians, and anime characters descend on Midtown Manhattan.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vb3uzX&via=Digg&text=Behind The Masks

div.div: YOU'VE BEEN WARNED

div.a: Say Hello To The Next 'Worst Music Video Ever'

div.div: Rebecca Black's "Friday" is a masterpiece worthy of several Grammys compared to this.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzeW1U&via=Digg&text=Say Hello To The Next 'Worst Music Video Ever'

div.div: HEISTS

div.a: Who Is Most Stolen Artist Of All Time?

div.div: What artists do art thieves crave most?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TbVnlD&via=Digg&text=Who Is Most Stolen Artist Of All Time?

div.div: WE ALL REMEMBER THE FIRST TIME

div.a: F-35 Stealth Fighter Finally Drops Its First Bomb

div.div: Amidst heavy criticism—and in the middle of a Presidential race that will be key to its future—the beleaguered F-35 Lightning II program keeps marching on.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U58o07&via=Digg&text=F-35 Stealth Fighter Finally Drops Its First Bomb

div.div: YOU PROBABLY WON'T MISS THEM

div.a: Seven Reasons Intel Could Be The Next RIM

div.div: There is a larger story behind Intel’s piece of the global slowdown in the growth of the semiconductor market. It’s a titanic shift in how we use technology.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P9Qbxj&via=Digg&text=Seven Reasons Intel Could Be The Next RIM

div.div: PRIVACY

div.a: Verizon Excited To Sell User Tracking Data

div.div: Your smartphone knows a lot about you. Verizon is betting that companies would like to know a lot about you, too.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U4PN49&via=Digg&text=Verizon Excited To Sell User Tracking Data

div.div: REALLY?

div.a: Female Senate Candidates Asked About 'Fifty Shades Of Grey'

div.div: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand and her challenger Wendy Long were asked if they have read the smutty and grammatically-challenged book during their only debate.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OJraI2&via=Digg&text=Female Senate Candidates Asked About 'Fifty Shades Of Grey'

div.div: ALSO CONFIRMED: NOT MADE OF CHEESE

It's a big claim, but Washington University in St. Louis planetary scientist Frédéric Moynier says his group has discovered evidence that the Moon was born in a flaming blaze of glory when a body the size of Mars collided with the early Earth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U4E7OP&via=Digg&text=How The Moon Was Born

div.div: BUT... WHY?

div.a: Brothers Wait Six Years To Claim Lottery Winnings

div.div: Two brothers from central New York have claimed a $5 million lottery prize for a scratch-off ticket they bought at their parents' Syracuse store six years ago, state officials said.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/REktnA&via=Digg&text=Brothers Wait Six Years To Claim Lottery Winnings

div.div: STILL NO CONSENSUS ON PRONUNCIATION

div.a: Tumblr Arranges IRL GIF Art Exhibition

div.div: GIFs might have finally broken the old-school stigma that came with its clunky ’90s predecessors. Tumblr is taking the animated images offline as part of a large-scale open call and exhibition, which will showcase GIFs as an art form in both digital and real space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tv2HmA&via=Digg&text=Tumblr Arranges IRL GIF Art Exhibition

div.div: IT'S NICE BEING RICH

div.a: Bloomberg Forms His Own Super PAC

div.div: Seeking to reshape a national political debate he finds frustratingly superficial, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York is plunging into the 2012 campaign in its final weeks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RU2rhX&via=Digg&text=Bloomberg Forms His Own Super PAC

div.div: NOT SAFE FOR FANBOYS

div.a: Will It Blend: iPhone 5 Vs. Samsung Galaxy S3

div.div: The folks at Blendtec are back and this time they have decided to pit both the Samsung Galaxy S3 and the iPhone 5 against each other to see which item can withstand the blending better.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OHpD55&via=Digg&text=Will It Blend: iPhone 5 Vs. Samsung Galaxy S3

div.div: WAR YEARS

div.a: Marines' Faces Before, During, And After Serving In Afghanistan

div.div: How do life-changing experiences concretely impact the way we look? Does tragedy truly show up in our eyes and brow?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PBTltO&via=Digg&text=Marines' Faces Before, During, And After Serving In Afghanistan
